text: The Church of Saint-Céneri-le-Gerei () is a Roman Catholic church in the commune of Saint-Cénéri-le-Gérei in north-western France. It was built in the late-11th and early-12th centuries. ==History== The building of the Church of Saint-Cénéri-le-Gérei was started in 1089 and ended in 1125. The structure is on a rocky cliff near the Sarthe river. The church has Norman characteristics. The church is made up of a nave and a with small chapels. It has a choir with a curved apse. The central tower has a roof with two sides. The old church was restored in 2006. ==References== ==Further reading== * ==Other websites== * Category:Roman Catholic churches in France Category:Orne Category:11th-century buildings and structures
title: Church of Saint-Céneri-le-Gerei
